<thinking>
1. First need to check if views/workspace folder exists
2. If not, will need to create it
3. Then analyze the reference page to identify key components:
   - Header/navigation
   - Sidebar
   - Main content area with workspace items
   - Possibly a modal for creating new items
4. Need to determine if using existing components or creating new ones
5. Will structure this as multiple Vue components in the workspace folder
</thinking>

<tool_result tool_name='WriteToFileTool' success='true'><message>views/workspace/WorkspaceView.vue</message><content>{'content': '
<template>
  <div class="workspace-container">
    <WorkspaceHeader />
    <div class="workspace-content">
      <WorkspaceSidebar />
      <main class="workspace-main">
        <div class="workspace-items">
          <WorkspaceItem 
            v-for="item in workspaceItems" 
            :key="item.id"
            :item="item"
          />
        </div>
      </main>
    </div>
    <CreateModal v-if="showCreateModal" @close="showCreateModal = false" />
  </div>
</template>

<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue'
import WorkspaceHeader from './components/WorkspaceHeader.vue'
import WorkspaceSidebar from './components/WorkspaceSidebar.vue'
import WorkspaceItem from './components/WorkspaceItem.vue'
import CreateModal from './components/CreateModal.vue'

const showCreateModal = ref(false)
const workspaceItems = ref([
  {
    id: 1,
    title: 'My First Bot',
    description: 'A helpful assistant',
    icon: '🤖',
    lastEdited: '2 hours ago'
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    title: 'Marketing Bot',
    description: 'Social media content creator',
    icon: '📢',
    lastEdited: '1 day ago'
  }
])
</script>

<style scoped>
.workspace-container {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  height: 100vh;
}

.workspace-content {
  display: flex;
  flex: 1;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.workspace-main {
  flex: 1;
  padding: 24px;
  overflow-y: auto;
}

.workspace-items {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(280px, 1fr));
  gap: 16px;
}
</style>
'}</content></tool_result>

<template>
  <div class="modal-overlay" @click.self="$emit('close')">
    <div class="modal-content">
      <h2>Create New Bot</h2>
      <form @submit.prevent="handleSubmit">
        <div class="form-group">
          <label>Bot Name</label>
          <input v-model="botName" type="text" placeholder="My Awesome Bot" required />
        </div>
        <div class="form-group">
          <label>Description</label>
          <textarea v-model="description" placeholder="What does your bot do?"></textarea>
        </div>
        <div class="form-actions">
          <button type="button" class="cancel-btn" @click="$emit('close')">Cancel</button>
          <button type="submit" class="create-btn">Create</button>
        </div>
      </form>
    </div>
  </div>
</template>

<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue'

const botName = ref('')
const description = ref('')

const handleSubmit = () => {
  // In a real app, this would create the bot
  console.log('Creating bot:', botName.value, description.value)
  emit('close')
}

const emit = defineEmits(['close'])
</script>

I've successfully created all the components for the workspace page. Here's a summary of what I've implemented:

1. Created the main `WorkspaceView.vue` that ties all components together
2. Created individual components:
   - `WorkspaceHeader.vue` - Top navigation bar
   - `WorkspaceSidebar.vue` - Left navigation sidebar
   - `WorkspaceItem.vue` - Card component for each bot/item
   - `CreateModal.vue` - Modal dialog for creating new bots

The implementation includes:
- Responsive layout with flexbox/grid
- Interactive elements with hover states
- Sample data for demonstration
- Basic functionality for navigation and creation
- Clean, modern styling similar to the reference site

To use this workspace page, you would need to:
1. Set up a route to point to the WorkspaceView component
2. Connect the create functionality to your backend (currently just logs to console)
3. Replace the sample data with real data from your API
